ygData.messageBody:
Yes, the ltr was camped yesterday by a level 50 warrior and a level 50
wizard. Sucked, cause I still needed one piece of equipment. All the level
35s had to go hunt elsewhere. Guess we will see there newbies decked out in
our armor, while we are still wearing bronze. 8(
----- Original Message -----
From: Krukhan Garabash <krukhan@...>
To: <shadowknight@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, November 02, 1999 3:02 PM
Subject: Re: [shadowknight] The madness explained!


> From: "Krukhan Garabash" <krukhan@...>
>
> "The no drop stat change is intentional, to balance the power of the
armor."
> -Brad
>
> good impression? i think it embodies the cryptic and seemingly mis or
> uninformed explanations that V's public figurehead dishes us rather well.
>
> really though, i tend to think this change was implemented to please the
> largest number of players. sad as it is, newbies and the elite alike
despise
> no drop equipment for the exact same reasons. it discourages twinking.
these
> days the question around the newbie zone isn't "where do i get that?" or
> "what kind of group do i need?" it's "how much?" or "how much?" or "sell
me
> yours?". while the elite on the other hand, feel they are being done a
> severe injustice every time they come across some leet lewt that can't
> easily be transferred to their twink projects (or sold to the
afformentioned
> newbies who amass mounds of plat with the latest greatest pietinesque
> sploit). so, by changing the no-drop stat they keep these two large and
> vocal groups of players satisfied.
>
> though, you would think that someone over there at VHQ would have noticed
> the stream of lv45+ campers who started monopolizing the TR after the
change
> in stats became common knowledge. personally, i've counted at least 4 5+
> hour decayed camps by very high level players since the change, no suprise
> that not one of them was an sk. (i guess someone will say this can be
> reported under verant's new "play nice rules" but the last time i
> reported/petition anything the response took well over 4 hours to arrive
> with the end effect being 0 due to the guide's apprectice status.)
>
> kg
>
> btw - to add to the frustration of an idiotic change like this. anyone
can
> complete the quests...ranger, bard, wood elf, human...so, now you have not
> only the threat of high level farmers but mid level quest sploiters who
hunt
> the TR or auction for spare decayed so that they (a human ranger for
> instance) can grab a gate to Fay and make 1/2 bubble or more xp for every
> piece they complete.
>
> why should a non sk be able to start or complete a quest for an sk ONLY
> item? (i know i already answered this with my own hypothesis but it would
be
> nice to see what everyone else thinks. especially a verantite if they
happen
> to read this.)
>
> >From: Countess Bathory D'Allatu <countess_bathory_69@...>
> >Reply-To: shadowknight@onelist.com
> >To: shadowknight@onelist.com
> >Subject: [shadowknight] The madness has begun...
